sentences: Natia Todua (Georgian: ნათია თოდუა; born 12 March 1996) is a Georgian-German singer.
section: N/A

sentences: She came to prominence in Germany after winning the seventh season of The Voice of Germany.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2018, Todua became a judge on the Georgian version of Idol.
section: N/A
== Life and career ==

sentences: Life and career ==
section: == Life and career ==
== Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Early life and Georgian career ===

sentences: 2014–2016: Early life and Georgian career
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Early life and Georgian career ===
== Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Early life and Georgian career ===

sentences: Todua was born in Tbilisi on 12 March 1996 to parents who fled Abkhazia during the War in Abkhazia of the early-1990s.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Early life and Georgian career ===

sentences: When she was two years old, her family returned to Abkhazia and settled in Gali District.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Early life and Georgian career ===

sentences: After completing school, she and her sister returned to Tbilisi, where Todua studied economics at Caucasus University.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Early life and Georgian career ===

sentences: She went on to take part in X Factor Georgia in 2014 and X-Factor Ukraine in 2015, but did not achieve success in the competitions.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014–2016: Early life and Georgian career ===
== Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Voice of Germany and Unser Lied für Lissabon ===

sentences: 2017–present: The Voice of Germany and Unser Lied für Lissabon =
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Voice of Germany and Unser Lied für Lissabon ===
== Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Voice of Germany and Unser Lied für Lissabon ===

sentences: In 2016, Todua moved to Germany where she began working as an au pair, living in Bruchsal.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Voice of Germany and Unser Lied für Lissabon ===

sentences: The following year, she auditioned for the seventh season of The Voice of Germany, and joined the team of Samu Haber.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Voice of Germany and Unser Lied für Lissabon ===

sentences: Todua progressed through the competition, and ultimately was chosen as the winner by the German public on 17 December 2017.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Voice of Germany and Unser Lied für Lissabon ===

sentences: Following her win, she was signed to Universal Music Group.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Voice of Germany and Unser Lied für Lissabon ===

sentences: On 29 December 2017, Todua was confirmed as a contestant in Unser Lied für Lissabon, the German national selection for the Eurovision Song Contest 2018.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Voice of Germany and Unser Lied für Lissabon ===

sentences: Her entry "My Own Way" was released on 20 February 2018, which went on to place last in the competition.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Voice of Germany and Unser Lied für Lissabon ===

sentences: In 2018, Todua became a judge on the Georgian version of Idol.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: The Voice of Germany and Unser Lied für Lissabon ===
